page.title: 13TRANSPORT - DOCKS - HISTORY
page.content: {TYNE DOCK}was opened{3rd. MARCH 1859. The first ship to dock was The {Recovery}with a cargo of coal. Thirty years later a new coal jetty was constructed to cope with the increased trade.A regiser of ships was started in 1859 and the first ship in the register was{The Eglantine}owned by Mr. Robert Wright.{Corporation Quay opened in 1861 and in 1864 the{Custom {House}was built at the Mill Dam. In 1865 The{Tyne Pilotage Board}was set up and{South Shields}was made a separate port from{N. Shields. Port Of Tyne Authority operate{Tyne Dock which is 4.8 Kilometres from the harbour entrance and covers an area of 80{Hectares.The Riverside Quay}is a riverside berth to the West of the dock entrance.The main loading and discharging berths are at the{North {West Quay}and the{Factory Quay.
